atq_text: Do you detect and block malicious signals that could hijack AI orchestration workflows?
Do AI decisions automatically comply with business and regulatory rules?
Do you detect and inventory all unauthorised AI systems operating in your environment?
Do you monitor for silent degradation or drift in AI recommendations over time?
Are third-party AI integrations protected against compromise affecting downstream systems?
Can you trace end-to-end AI decisions and actions for audits?
Do you monitor and limit AI workloads to prevent compute or infrastructure exhaustion?
Do you prevent over-automation leading to unintended consequences?
Have you assessed switching costs and dependencies on single AI vendors?
Do you monitor for gradual erosion of ethical standards in AI usage?
Do you protect models against malicious inputs that override system instructions?
Do you prevent attackers from querying models to steal weights or behaviour?
Do you defend against crafted inputs designed to cause misclassification?
Do you prevent bypassing of model safety guardrails and restrictions?
Do you stop reconstruction of training data from model outputs?
Do you detect and mitigate high-confidence incorrect predictions?
Do you identify and correct bias amplification from poisoned training data?
Do you scan for hidden triggers causing malicious model behaviour?
Do you monitor models for silent degradation due to distribution shift?
Do you preserve traceability markers against removal attempts?
Do you restrict agents from calling destructive or high-privilege tools inappropriately?
Do you ensure agents pursue only intended objectives without deviation?
Do you protect agents from prompt injection hijacking reasoning via malicious context?
Do you prevent agents from escalating to unauthorised system access or privileges?
Do you safeguard shared memory from corruption affecting other agents?
Do you detect and terminate agents stuck in recursive tool calling loops?
Do you block multi-hop data leaks through agent tool chains?
Do you enforce human oversight for high-risk agent actions?
Do you manage context size to prevent agent hallucination from overflow?
Do you monitor benign tool chaining for potential malicious outcomes?
Do you scan datasets for malicious poisoning embedding backdoors or biases?
Do you detect undiscovered personal data in datasets to avoid GDPR violations?
Do you monitor datasets for distribution shifts degrading model performance?
Do you identify embedded API keys or credentials in training datasets?
Do you vet upstream/third-party datasets for compromise or poisoning?
Do you enforce data retention policies to limit breach blast radius?
Do you maintain audit trails for all dataset modifications and sources?
Do you validate datasets for completeness to prevent garbage-in-garbage-out?
Do you protect against attacks inferring if records were in training sets?
Do you ensure synthetic data quality avoids mimicking real poisoning effects?
Do you detect and revoke stolen API keys used for model extraction or fraud?
Do you protect against high-volume attacks bypassing rate limits?
Do you block malicious payloads injected via API poisoning model context?
Do you enforce least-privilege scopes on API tokens?
Do you sanitise error messages to avoid leaking prompts or secrets?
Do you isolate tenants to prevent cross-client interference?
Do you impose quotas to bound API compute consumption?
Do you strengthen rate limits against abuse patterns?
Do you log API calls for abuse detection and audits?
Do you rotate API keys and replace legacy/basic auth?
Do you block unauthorised MCP servers from receiving agent context?
Do you minimise excessive data shared with MCP tools?
Do you encrypt all MCP communications to prevent MITM attacks?
Do you validate MCP tools against malicious code execution?
Do you monitor MCP tool chaining for unintended outcomes?
Do you maintain a registry to detect shadow MCP deployments?
Do you enforce strong authentication for MCP tool calls?
Do you monitor data egress via MCP channels?
Do you detect MCP configuration drifts from approved states?
Do you isolate MCP servers to limit impact from compromises?
